definition: morning newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Morning Post
China Business Morning Post (morning edition of China Business News 華商報|华商报)

sentences.english: Beijing Morning Post and Chinese Geography.
Below crisis of banking of morning paper dispatch, situation of trade of Chinese inside and outside is occurrent change.
sentences.chinese: 晨报讯金融危机下，中国内外贸格局正在发生变化。

sentences.english: That includes a continental breakfast and a morning news parer .
sentences.chinese: 包括欧洲大陆式早餐和一份晨报。

sentences.english: There wsignificishly news in the morning paper today.
sentences.chinese: 此日的晨报上有许多新闻。

sentences.english: Morning edition and old-fashion oatmeal bubble in the background.
sentences.chinese: 晨报与旧式的燕麦泡泡是不变的背景。

sentences.english: There wa lot as news in the morning paper today.
sentences.chinese: 即日的晨报上有许多音信。

sentences.english: The morning paper news since this year, A market IPO speed obviously postpones .
sentences.chinese: 晨报讯今年以来，A股市场IPO速度明显放缓。

sentences.english: If you subscribe to the morning paper, it’ll be delivered to your door.
sentences.chinese: 如果你订阅晨报，会送报上门。

sentences.english: He read the morning paper cover to cover.
sentences.chinese: 他把晨报逐页从头看到尾。

sentences.english: Chongqing Morning Post 6 years has been closely watching the forefront of progress every step of life.
sentences.chinese: 重庆晨报已连续6年密切关注前沿生物的每一步进展。

sentences.english: The most famous is The Times.
sentences.chinese: 最著名的晨报是《泰晤士报》。

definition: evening newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Evening News
citizen journalist (typically posting short, self-produced documentary videos on the Web)
